text: the following reports contained some
disturbing images a London gallop as
their father Abdullah will always
remember them not as icons of suffering
but as his boys today he came to see
them and their drowned mother Rehan at
the local mortuary he told me the family
had paid nearly 5000 euros to a smuggler
who then abandoned them I remember the
smuggler took us after four or five
minutes the waves were very high and he
jumped off and escaped another high wave
pushed the boat over I tried to catch my
children and wife but there was no hope
one by one they died the children's
deaths have stirred a passionate outcry
but Abdullah Kurdi thoughts were far
from politics today what kind of
children were they Island and his
brother my children we're the most
beautiful in the world
is there anybody for whom their child is
not the most precious thing they woke me
every day to play with me what is more
beautiful than this everything is gone
the Turkish authorities have arrested
several alleged smugglers after the
incident but many more are still
operating
why can't turkey stopped the smugglers
who are helping to create this death the
cases of trafficking have gone up by 150
percent in the last year especially of
Syrians they want to get to Greece by
illegal means we cannot arrange a
security guard for each of these
refugees people must obey the laws and
wait for the benefits the government has
said it will repatriate the dead
children and their mother to Syria mr.
al Kurdi will now take his family back
to Syria for burial the country that
they fled from to escape violence this
is the story of one family's tragedy but
it's been repeated countless times and
it will happen again as more and more
desperate people flee Syria to find
safety in Europe
Friedel King BBC News Turkey
